headline: American Electric Power (AEP): Reassessing Valuation After a Recent Pause in Share Price Momentum
summary: American Electric Power Company (AEP) has quietly pulled back about 6% over the past month, even as its year to date return remains strong, inviting a closer look at what the market is pricing in. See our latest analysis for American Electric Power Company. The recent 1 month share price return of negative 5.55 percent looks more like a pause than a reversal, given American Electric Power Company’s strong year to date share price return of 24.61 percent and a 1 year total shareholder return...

headline: Does AEP’s US$72 Billion Grid Expansion And Data Center Focus Change The Bull Case For AEP?
summary: Earlier this month, American Electric Power Company raised its long-term EPS growth outlook to 7%–9% and expanded its five-year capital investment plan to US$72.00 billion, supported by long-term agreements with Quanta Services to build high-voltage transmission for rising data center-driven demand. This combination of a larger growth target, a significantly bigger grid buildout, and dedicated construction partners suggests AEP is repositioning itself as a core supplier of power...

headline: The AI Power Trade Is Getting Tricky. Stocks to Consider in 2026.
summary: Electricity is a hot commodity, now that tech companies are paying a premium for it to power their artificial-intelligence data centers.  Utilities have ridden the trend to 23% returns in 2024 and 16% returns so far this year.  Most notably, politicians have grown concerned about increases in electricity rates and are already pressuring utilities to keep rates steady or even lower them.

headline: Assessing American Electric Power After Its Strong 2024 Rally and Dividend Outlook
summary: If you are wondering whether American Electric Power Company is still good value after its run up, you are not alone. This article will unpack what the current price might really be telling us about potential future returns. The stock trades around $114.57 after slipping about 1.3% over the last week and 5.5% over the last month, but it is still up 24.6% year to date and 29.0% over the last year. This suggests the market has been steadily warming to its story despite recent softness. Recent...
